text: A sea of people BUZZING in excitement -- reporters, officials, men in dark suits. Occasional flashes of color women in brighter attire elbow through the crowd. Screens hover overhead, each alive with rows of numbers. Traders shouting orders, flashbulbs popping, constant videotaping on cell phones.
What a historic day Eric! And now we pull back, realizing that the chaos at the sto exchange is actually happening on a TV screen.

We see the face of a beautiful woman, her sharp eyes focu on the screen. This is NAOMI, early 40’s, poised, tough, brilliant, and pissed off by what she’s watching. On the TV, a bubbly female reporter holds court at the ed of the crowd.

You’ve seen the hordes of people cheering, just now I think we had the biggest WOO I’ve heard all day. Nobody expected Dynacorps stock to climb to 47-- An impersonal sleek hotel room. Naomi gazes at the TV, as gets ready to head out for a day of meetings. A second reporter, back at the studio.
This IPO is certainly one of the biggest we've seen this year-- Naomi shuts off the TV. She keeps her gaze on the empty screen a moment. She exha
So, what happened with Dynacorps?
NAOMI wines and dines an eager 25-year-old male CEO of a company. He talks with his mouth full.  2 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
They elected to work with Channing Trust for the offering.
But you had a long history with those guys, didn’t you? She meets his gaze. Around them, chopsticks fly over colo platters. TECH CEO (CONT’D) Word is you low-balled them on pricing.
Pricing is a judgment call.
But ultimately they IPO’d at the higher price.
Listen Doug, I’ve taken 9 Silicon Valley companies public in the last five years. You want to talk about the one I didn’t take to the finish line? Naomi leans forward, enjoying herself.

Here's what nobody wants to admit. Everything is a judgment call. And yes, you need to trust your banker, because this is a partnership. You guys are the innovators, who can build technology the rest of us are not even imagining. But without funding, that’s just tinkering ina garage. I work for the largest investment bank in the world. And we both know I found you guys capital when you were a couple of kids with a laptop and a dream. So we can talk about last year’s IPO calendar, or we can talk about how to grow your company so you can build technology that’s going to transform people’s lives. The Ceo nods, impressed.  3 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
You try the Tasmanian Sea Trout? Naomi smiles and pops one in her mouth.

head_text.subj: EXT. NEW YORK SKYLINE. EVENING, (STOCK FOOTAGE)

text: A plane lands against the backdrop of the shimmering buildings of the city.

Naomi gazes at the lights of the city gliding by from the back of a luxury car. INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 6 We track through the apartment, finding the remnants of dinner for two, takeout on fancy plates, an empty wine bottle, a pair of discarded high heels. On the balcony, MICHAEL pours amber scotch into a glass. is late 40s, handsome and charismatic. He hands the glass Naomi. Michael is sharp; nothing gets past this guy. They are in Michael's dimly lit enormous loft apartment. Michael plays with Naomi’s hair.
You smell like the ocean.
You smell like noodles. Singapore?
Hong Kong. Naomi takes a sip of scotch.
What have you heard?
I’m in a completely different division of the bank.
You’re on the exec. Restructuring? Randall’s retiring? He hesitates, gives in.  4 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Yes.
They’1l need a new global head.
Now you’re beyond my scope.
I’m a top producer for this firm.
Naomi. He tucks her hair behind her ear.
You lost a major client. She looks at him sharply.
Are you saying I should be worried? He hesitates.
No. You’ll be fine.
It’s late. She slips into her shoes.
Stay.
I’m exhausted.
We’ll crash early. What’s so good about your bed anyway? She looks at him, brings her face close to his, seductive
Threadcount. And she’s out the door.

5 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 7 An enormous bed with rumpled luxury sheets. The bed is em Through a doorway we see Naomi in an office alcove, typin the computer in a silk nightgown.

Naomi walks past a conference room with 10 senior male bankers in an intense conversation. One of them glances u her through the glass. Suddenly she feels self-conscious- could they be talking about her? She moves on briskly. INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. DAY 9 As Naomi heads into her office, her chatty ASSISTANT hand her an espresso.
How was your weekend?

Fine, thanks Gloria. A sleek, large office. A row of Lucite deal trophies line shelf. Naomi clicks through her email with lightning speed. ERIN enters the office in a stylish suit, carrying a heav pitch book. Erin is 34, smart, pretty and athletic.
San Fran good? Naomi keeps her eyes on the screen.
You read up on the companies? Which one stands out?
I was looking at--  6 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Cachet. I’ve got a hunch they’re looking to expand. You've got numbers on them? Erin glances down at her book. She does not have those numbers.
I will send them right over. Naomi nods and starts typing something. She notices Erin still standing there.
Everyone's saying there’s going to be some movement around here... and I am wondering if this might be the time to--
No, not right now. Naomi’s fingers fly over the keyboard. Erin does not budg Naomi finally turns her full attention to her.
I told you I’d make a push for you. And I will. But right now HR is out there snatching Blackberries.
I get that. But I’ve been under- compensated two years in a row.
It’s a down year. And I am still getting feedback that you are... too nice.
Who says that?
Clients, for one.
How can you be too nice to clients?
(Sincerely) Erin, we will get you there. You have to trust me on this one.
10 11 12 7 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Erin nods.
I need those numbers.

Erin tries to stop herself from crying in a bathroom stal INT. ERIN’S OFFICE. NIGHT 10 A janitor pushes a mop down the quiet deserted hallway. O a few of the offices are lit. In one of them, Erin revises graphs in a smaller, but sti nicely-decorated office. She rubs her eyes, stretches her neck, and reaches for a plastic cup of green juice which has the word KALE scribb on it. She grimaces as she drinks. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 11 Naomi gets ready for bed, washing her face, taking out he diamond earrings. Her jewelry is neatly arranged in boxes from Tiffany's. She climbs into bed, switching on a flatscreen TV, clicki to resume an episode of Scandal. Her laptop BINGS. She mutes Scandal as she grabs the lapt and opens an attachment from Erin, labeled CACHET. She be expertly scanning the data.
Naomi moves swiftly through the office, looking over the papers as she walks, Erin at her side.
These are their latest projections? Naomi holds out a graph.
That can’t be right--
I know, I just caught that.  13 14 8 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Who did this graph?
Teddy. I told you, he’s careless. Naomi stops abruptly. Turns so she can see in the distanc bunch of young Associates at their cubicles.
When did they all start growing these mustaches?
I’m sure there’s a bet. TEDDY, 24, boyish with a hint of a mustache, laughs loudl projecting nothing but ease and confidence.
Who’s fucking kid is he again?
Nephew. Lawrence Sidel.
Jesus Christ.
I can fix it.
The mustache? Erin smiles, reaching for the papers.
Thank you.

Naomi walks briskly towards Randall's office. Out of the corner of her eye, she notices a 53 year old executive in nice suit carrying a box of belongings, flanked by two bu security guards. INT. RANDALL’S OFFICE. DAY 14 A gorgeous office with floor-to-ceiling windows. Many Luc trophies and framed portraits of bankers with executives.  9 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Naomi faces RANDALL, Global Head of Equity Capital Market late 50s, imposing, deliberate. He’s been at the top for long time. A perky HR WOMAN, early 30’s, stands nearby, flipping thr a file, and watching Randall, who stares at a small tower Jenga blocks on his gleaming desk. Naomi waits, on edge. Randall carefully pulls out a Jenga block. The tower bare trembles.
Naomi. Thanks for coming in.
Of course. Naomi glances at the HR woman.
You know Leslie, from HR. She needs a couple more names, from your department. Naomi relaxes almost imperceptibly, nods.
Teddy Sidel, and Arthur Abbott.
You do know who Teddys’s uncle is?
You asked me to identify the weakest performers. What you do with that information is up to you. HR Woman smirks, nods to Randall, and goes.
I’m sure you’ve heard the talk. I’m gettin out. Retiring.
Congratulations.
You never want to stay too late at the party. He gestures to the trophies around the office.  15 10 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
And this particular party is sobering up. Randall turns back to his blocks.
Your turn. Naomi looks at him, a bit surprised. She reaches for one the blocks and pushes it gently.
Steady now. Naomi pulls the block out; the tower remains intact.
So they’1l be naming a new group head. He looks her in the eye.
Look, Naomi, I’m going to be frank with you. This doesn’t look like your year.
Because of Dynacorps.

I’ve asked around about what happened there. The perception is... that you rubbed some people the wrong way. Naomi’s face is unreadable; she does not want to betray h true feelings. Randall does not look away from her.

They're looking for a rainmaker. Naomi smiles tightly. We begin to hear the sounds of punching, grunting. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 15 Naomi kickboxes violently, her TRAINER meeting every blow with his pads. Sweat runs down her face.
You’re hesitating! Go, go, go!!!  16 11 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She freezes for a second, then lunges forward with a prim scream.
Naomi refills her scotch and hands one to Michael.
I mean at least hit me with facts. Use my numbers against me, but perception-- what the fuck do I do with that?
You never really told me, what happened with Dynacorps.
I’m sure you read the tweets. Apparently I wore the wrong outfit. He shakes his head.

The truth is I don’t know. And it’s my fucking alarm clock. Three, four in the morning, I’m asking myself-- what the fuck happened?? Replaying the negotiations in my head, the valuation, the pricing. I’ve been in hundreds of those meetings and I’ve never had one go south. He looks at her, surprised she is being so candid with hi
You don’t do that, right? Men don’t lose sleep over this stuff.
Oh we do. But we don’t turn on ourselves. More fun to be pissed at someone else. She smiles.
What’s the biggest deal you could get. Right now.  17 12 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Cachet just hired their 12th board member.
So they’re looking to go public. She nods, tasting the adrenaline of her next pursuit.
I found vc’s for that kid when he had five employees.

An lofty space lined with bookshelves and high windows. Naomi mingles effortlessly, laughing and chatting with an ethnically diverse crowd of women, mostly in their 20s. S is a star, but an approachable one, with women clamoring talk to her. SAMANTHA, beautiful, tough, and smartly dressed, watches Naomi from across the room. She is familiar with Naomi’s charisma. She chooses her moment to approach.
Naomi Bishop? Naomi turns, smiles warmly.
Samantha Ryan.
I thought you hated alumni events!
Well, you know. Important to give back. Especially to mentor the-- She turns, noticing a large sign reading “City Women,” wi cartoon drawing of a giant high heel climbing a building.
Is that the logo? Sam laughs.
I think these young women look at me like what not to do. (MORE )
Like how to go to law school and still end up broke.
There must be at least one young idealist out there. How are things? You’re still at the US Attorney's, locking up the drug dealers?
I’m actually in your area now. White collar crime. Securities division.
Well, good for you.
And you're still
at Remson? I'm a lifer. Golden handcuffs. You got a file on us?
I imagine we’ve got a file on everybody. They are smiling, but this hangs in the air a moment. SAM (CONT’D) Let’s get that drink we always swear we will and never do. I know, you're very busy-
Let’s do it. It’s been too long.
I’1l call-- your have people? Naomi just smiles at this. INT. MENTORING EVENT SPACE. Faces of various women, as together Asian YOUNG WOMAN people. You do
they listen intently. A put- takes the microphone.
I’m wondering, for each of you, what’s that thing that really makes you want to get up in the morning?  19 14 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Naomi, Samantha, and three other women face the audience.
I guess the simplest answer is: I like money. Some people laugh nervously, but the women in the audienc are loving this. Sam listens.

I do. I mean that’s the honest answer. I like numbers, I like a challenge, I love negotiation. But let's just be clear. I really like money. I like knowing I have it. I grew up without money, in a house where there was never enough. I was raised by a single mom with four kids. I took my first job on Wall Street so I could pay for my little brothers to go to college. Remson gave me that chance and I’ve been there ever since. Naomi sees a woman nodding sympathetically.

But I’m not going to stand here and tell you I only do what I do so I can take care of other people. Because it is okay to do it for ourselves. For how it makes us feel. Secure? Yes. Powerful? When you understand VALUE, COST, what we will pay for, what we will risk, and what we can build? That’1l get you up in the morning. Sam leans forward now, intrigued.

I’m glad it’s acceptable now for women to talk openly about ambition. But don’t let money be a dirty word. We can like that too. EXT. U.S. ATTORNEY’S OFFICE. DAY People swarm up the courthouse steps.  20 21 15 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. U.S. ATTORNEY’S OFFICE. DAY Sam reviews a spreadsheet in the spare space, under fluorescent lights. Her colleague, FRANK, 40's, a guy from like it is, appears in the doorway.
20 and somewhat cluttered Brooklyn who calls it You go to the thing? You talk to her? Your friend?
I did.
And? She give you anything on the hedge fund guy?
I haven’t seen the woman in 5 years. What is it you think she’s going to give me, during our appearance at a Vassar alumni reception?
Look, this was your idea to get to the bank this way.
I said I would make contact.
And?

I made contact. He just stares at her. She gives hima reaches for a stack of files and opens INT. U.S. ATTORNEY’S OFFICE. NIGHT Samantha munches a Snickers bar as she spreadsheets, memos, and reports. confident smile. She the one on top. 21 pours over She scribbles names and numbers on a legal pad -- “Remson “Michael Connor” “Titanite.”  22 23 16 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 22 The kitchen is open to the living room. Naomi opens her fridge, revealing immaculate shelves. A bottle of wine, a couple of takeout containers, a giant bag of carrots. She grabs a box of upscale fish food. She turns to a square tank containing a spectacular beta fish, and sprinkles the food into the water. The tank see unusually large for such a small creature. INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 23 Erin packs haphazardly by the light of her phone. Her hus GABE, 35, groans from the bed. He’s charming, smart, and to-earth.
What time’s your car coming?
Jesus. You need to sleep.
Please don’t tell me what I need.
I get it, you have to win the bake sale. She smiles.
Bake off.
Bring me a brownie?
A brownie? I’m bringing home the fucking bakery. She climbs into bed.
I hope I never have to battle you for anything.
‘Cause you’d lose!  24 25
17. Green Rev. (07/15/15) He grabs her, pulling her to him.
(laughing, between kisses) 4:30!!
The plane touches down. Quick montage of images of San Francisco: the sloping streets, Chinatown, the trolley.
Naomi opens the door of her room to Erin, who holds out a stack of papers. Erin stifles a yawn. Erin nods,
New specs.
Terrific.
Is there anything else you need?
I need my team to stay awake for the pitch tomorrow. Go on, get some rest. grateful.
They do have a whole menu of pillows here.
I'd go with number five.
Good choice. Soft edges, firm at the core.  26 18 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She turns to go.
Teddy and BILL, a young African-American Associate, take peek at Naomi and Erin who practice the pitch behind glas doors. Bill leans in to Teddy.
What do you think she makes?
Five fifty base.
Okay, but what’s the bonus? I mean it’s true, right, the girls get less? Teddy sees that Naomi and Erin are emerging through the g doors.
And here they are. Game time ladies! Naomi just looks at him.
You know what's fascinating about you, Teddy? You are a survivor. He looks at her quizzically. Erin tries to hide a smile. A team of men in stunning suits goes past them, chuckling
Was that Channing? Teddy nods.
My uncle says Remson’s eyeing that tall guy. For next Global Head. He trails off, unnerved by Naomi’s steely gaze.
Boys, we have a pitch to give. She is focused, like an athlete just before a game.  27 19 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

A less corporate, funkier conference room than those we h seen. On the wall, a giant gold key made up of lines of c The CEO, ED, 29, is flanked by his CFO, IAN, a numbers wi who protects Ed like a younger brother, at the head of a table crowded with casually dressed managers. Ed still ha the look of a kid who plays too many video games. Restles energy pulses under his casual exterior. Teddy and Bill distribute pitch books. Erin notices that pens say “Channing Trust,” left behind by the competition She casually flicks one into a nearby trashcan as Naomi begins the pitch. Naomi lives for this; she is in her element.
When I was a kid, if you wanted privacy, if you wanted to send a secret message, you made invisible ink with vinegar. Teddy proudly displays a large seemingly blank piece of poster board.

And when you were ready to “go public” you revealed your message with grape juice. Bill takes a large paintbrush dipped in grape juice and “paints” across the posterboard. The Remson logo appears purple as he does this. People are nodding, smiling. They appreciate this touch. Naomi sees Ian and a few others opening the pitch book, a gives a silent go-ahead to Erin. Numbers time.

But Cachet has certainly taken privacy to the next level, and we are so pleased to have the chance to foster that growth. If you open your books to page 2, you’ll see in the first model, that we are predicting a valuation of $820 million at 34 to 36 a share. Ian and Ed flip through the graphs and models.  28 29 30 20 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Well, you’re certainly presenting us with some compelling numbers...
You guys can see we’ve done our homework. But that’s not why you’re going to give us this deal.
Okay...

I remember what you told me the first day we met: we’re not a social media company with privacy settings, we’re a privacy company that can build a social network. An impenetrable social network. I understood that. The NEED for that. I felt it in my gut. Some people thought you guys were paranoid, investors wouldn't go for it. Now fast forward: Edward Snowden, nude photos of actresses, the Sony hack. Your revenue jumps. Your competitors start rolling out. But we were ahead of the curve. Because we understood that every day it gets harder to trust people in this world. And security is the hottest commodity around. Ed is nodding. Ian looks impressed. Others are too. Erin catches Naomi’s eye. They’ve got this.
An airplane touches down in New York. INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. DAY 30 Naomi’s fingers fly over the keyboard. Financial news pla in the background, muted. The phone rings and she grabs it.
Naomi.  31 32 33 21 Green Rev. (07/15/15) A moment. She breaks into a wide smile.
Well I am glad to hear that. We see the IPO Reporter on the television screen in her office, then start to hear:

In tech news, get out your IPO calendar-- As we CUT TO INT. ERIN’S OFFICE. DAY 31 Erin holds a plank pose on her elbows, hovering over her blackberry. A message pops up and her eyes light up as sh jumps to her feet.

The privacy company Cachet is going public. Cachet has been seeing record growth recently in the wake of the public’s keen interest in security. INT. SAM’S OFFICE. DAY 32 Sam watches the coverage at her desk, chewing on a pen.
The lead banker on the deal is said to be Naomi Bishop. INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. DAY 33 We are back on Naomi watching her TV screen.

Apparently some money managers were surprised to hear this news, after Bishop was reported to ruffle some feathers during a tech IPO earlier this year-- Naomi, unfazed, reaches over and switches off the news.  34 22 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 34 Naomi eyes are on her BlackBerry. Michael playfully takes from her, replacing it with a champagne glass. They clink glasses.
You know what’s funny about the privacy space? Half the world is paranoid and the other half never even resets their passwords.
It’s true.
For 20 years, my password for everything was Rudolphl.
Like the reindeer?
I had a dog. When I was a kid.
Ahww.
What about you? Lamest password?
I’m not telling you my passwords.
Old ones. Circa 1996.
Bankerchick.
Now that is hot. He grabs her roughly for a kiss. She presses against him, smelling him, unzipping him as THE BUZZER sounds.
(Frustrated) That’s Erin.
Who? Naomi buttons her blouse as Michael zips up.  23 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
My VP, she’s dropping off the revisions. She presses the buzzer button.
(Amused) You buzz people up to my apartment now? Naomi opens the door. Erin approaches awkwardly holding o pile of binders.
Erin, nice to see you.
Hi, sorry-- Naomi takes the binders.
Thanks.
Goodnight! Naomi shuts the door.
Where were we? He pulls Naomi to him and tosses her onto the couch. They move fast, frantic for each other.
The early morning light streaks through the window. Naomi twisted over Michael asleep on the couch. We hear:
Hey babe. It’s me. You were a tiger last night. Am I seeing you later?
You’re calling me on this line?  36 24 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Sam and ABBY, a stylish compliance lawyer, listen to a recording.
Hey compliance! FYI. This is a strictly personal phone call.
Michael -- we can’t be -- Sam realizes it is Naomi she’s listening to. She leans forward.

You guys monitoring? You hear anything about clients? ‘Cause the only wall we’re crossing is... THE WALL OF LOVE. There is muffled laughter in the background, as if someon the trading floor is egging him on.
You are an idiot. Abby clicks off the recording.
Never a dull moment here in compliance.
That’s his company phone? Is that crossing the wall? I mean she’s on the banking side--
Well technically there’s nothing criminal here--
Remson doesn’t have a policy prohibiting this kind of romantic--
Some banks do, but nope.
And what’s your gut about this guy?  37 25 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Michael? He’s got instincts. Some people have instincts and some people are getting a tip.
And?
We keep an eye on him.
Frank mentioned you used to be an AUSA? You ever miss it?
Wearing the white hat? Sure. But you know what they say, you can’t spread ideals on a cracker.

Do you actually know people who say that? Abby smiles politely. INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. MORNING 37 Michael makes espresso as a half-dressed Naomi making her down the stairs. He goes to her, plays with her hair.
What’s that? He touches a tiny patch of reddish skin, barely visible j below her jawline. She fingers it.
Nothing. She begins to delicately put on her diamond earrings. He admires her.
Remind me why I didn’t marry you.
Diamonds. He looks curious.  26 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Remson Holiday party. Ninety- something. Randall introduced us.
The St. Regis. Naomi indicates the earrings.

You asked me who bought these. And I saw you, gearing up to fight off some rival. But then I told you I bought them for myself. After my dad left I watched my mom leave her best earrings at the pawn shop. We never got them back. So I wanted to be able to buy enough diamonds for both of us.
You never told me that. She smiles as if at an unspoken memory.
But men like a girl they can take care of.
Yeah? Someone should warn them about the alimony. Naomi laughs. She pulls on her heels.
You’re more fun divorced anyway.
Well congrats again. People seem to like Cachet. You remember my buddy Marco?
From Stanford. The tech blog guy?
He’s always writing about privacy. Encryption, whisper-phones, all kinds of spy shit. Cachet could be big.
We certainly hope so.  38 27 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I mean you think these Cachet guys are onto something. She looks at him, suddenly cautious.
We do.
Due diligence started yet?
Michael.
You want a Chinese Wall in my living room? I didn’t ask you anything.
I just think it’s simpler, not to talk shop.
You think that some of the time. She looks at him sharply.
I mean if it’s about you, your prospects at the firm, you’re happy to talk shop.
That’s completely different.
Okay. She set down her cup very deliberately.
I am going to go to work now. She goes to the door.

Wine flows into glasses, and fingers reach for hors d’‘oe Naomi, Erin, Teddy, Bill and a few others celebrate the d They are toasting and doing shots. Naomi looks relaxed, carefree.  39 28 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

I’m telling you. Photos of Ed and all his programmers. Hanging out in a hot tub. Bill holds out his phone to Teddy. Erin shakes her head, laughing. Naomi notices Randall crossing over to them from another table. They follow her gaze. Teddy starts to get up.
No no, don’t get up. I’m with a client. I just wanted to say congratulations. Great work, all of you.
Thank you. She makes a decision.
You know Erin-- He doesn’t.
Of course.
She did really spectacular work on this.
Always good to know. Again, congratulations. Erin smiles, pleased, as Randall shakes her hand. RANDALL (CONT’D) I recommend the porterhouse.

Erin heads to the sink, holding a martini glass with an o half hidden by her purse. She pours out the drink and beg filling the glass with tap water. The door swings open. Naomi. Erin meets her gaze in the mirror. Erin finishes filling the glass.  40 41 29 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
How far along are you?
It’s really early. Six weeks. Naomi nods, smiles tightly.
Well. It’s very exciting. Congratulations. She disappears into a stall. Erin takes a deep breath and heads back to the restaurant.

location: FINE RESTAURANT. A FEW MINUTES LATER 40

text: Back at the table. The men devour steaks, Naomi finishes salad.
Look, anyone can make money selling information, but here was a guy who thought it was more valuable to protect it. She looks at Erin, noticing she has barely touched her porterhouse steak.
I mean we all understand the value of privacy. Erin looks up, a flicker of anger as she meets Naomi’s pointed gaze.
Information is power. Bill and Teddy don’t quite understand the sudden tension.
Fuck yea. INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 4l Erin aggressively tears open a giant box, as Gabe looks u from his newspaper.  30 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I don’t understand. Did Naomi think you were going to call her the minute you peed on the stick?
I don’t know. She aggressively tears open the box, clothes spill out.
You think she wishes she had kids?
No. I don’t. I don’t think all women wish they had kids. What is all this                         Erin pulls a long mumu thing out of the box, dangling it from her.
Clothes. Maternity. My sister sent them--
You told her?
I’m excited. You know my family, we get excited. Erin shoves the clothing back in the box.
I’m not ready for this.
We really should get longer to prepare. The Alpine Salamander is pregnant for three years.
That sounds horrible!
My eight graders are obsessed with them. After sex the female stores the sperm in this “semen pouch” --

Ew! But she is laughing.  42 31 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 42 A cozy and colorful space crowded with well-loved furnish and toys strewn about. Sam perches on a kitchen stool, scrolling through her lap SOPHIE, 6, pours milk sloppily into a glass held by her t WILLIAM. Sam’s wife, MELANIE, an African-American woman with the strong, graceful body of a dancer, tugs on her boots.
Which babysitter?? Sam peers at an online pic of Benji Akers, 40s, snowboard under a headline which reads: WOULD YOU TRUST THIS MAN WI
Hello! Sam! Sam finally looks up.
Sophie wants to know who’s watching them tonight.
Lisa from downstairs--
I HATE Lisa--
You don’t hate Lisa--
She’s got weird hair.
She’s not a REAL babysitter.
They've got a point-- I mean you know I have rehearsal every Tuesday...
Something came up-- it happens!  43 32 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Drinks. With some friend from childhood?
I told you-- it’s work.
What, you're investigating her? Is this one of your Kalinda Sharma undercover routines?
Lisa is fine. She’s affordable. And you -- She reaches out to pull the twins in for a playful squeez SAM (CONT’D) You crazies like the games on her phone. Sam kisses the giggling twins.
Quality child care. But she can’t help but smile at them.
Sam and Naomi drink colorful cocktails. Naomi admires a picture of Sam’s kids on Sam’s phone.
They're terrific. She hands the phone back. A beat. Sam seems a little unsu how to reciprocate the small talk. Naomi gestures at her phone.
I got nieces, nephews and a Beta. Sam laughs awkwardly.
It’s a fish.
Oh, yeah, I...  33. Green Rev. (07/15/15)
So, you’re a mom, you're a lesbian, what else is new? Sam laughs again, less awkward.
And I do yoga now.
Of course you do. I’1l tell my brother I saw you. He thinks every girl he ever dated turned gay. Sam smiles fondly.
How is Pete? And the rest of your family? Everybody still in Michigan?
Yes. In that 30 mile radius. They're fine. Naomi finishes her drink, notices Sam checking out the fe bartender.
Are you seeing anyone?
I get what I need.
Yeah? Do tell. I’m just a boring married lady. Someone from work?
Where else. Sam nods. She is trying to figure out how to play this.
I dated a colleague once, but it got claustrophobic.
We don’t see each other day-to-day.
Smart. So what, a broker? Naomi looks at her.  34 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Yes, actually.
Huh. Does that cause any...
Any...
I mean there must be certain things you can’t share--
What are you doing? Here I thought we were just two old friends having a drink.
We are.
Could we get the check please? (To Sam) His name is Michael Connor. But maybe you already know that.
No. I mean -- She looks at Naomi. Nothing is getting by this woman. SAM (CONT’D) Ok. I did come across his name recently, in the office. As somebody who--
Who--
Works with a lot of hedge funds.
Yes. That is what he does. Naomi puts a $100 bill down and stands to go.
(STOCK FOOTAGE)

The conference room buzzes with people, mostly men, inclu Ed and Ian. Conversation quiets as Naomi and her team str into the room. Naomi notices MARIN, a woman with purple h whisper something to the CFO and hurry out of the room. Naomi takes a seat next to Ed.
Good afternoon, everyone. We'd like to start off with a preliminary discussion of pricing--
Let’s do it. Where are we at?
At this point, we’re looking at a range of $32 to $34 a share. At 7.2 million shares, that gives us a valuation of 868 million--
Now just a minute here--
We gotta have a billion valuation.
We've looked at the comparables, and--
You said $34 to $36 in the pitch. You’re going to leave tens of millions of dollars on the table.
We can get at least 35. Naomi hesitates. She needs this to go smoothly.

(diplomatically) Well it’s a balancing act. Raising money for the company, while still promising the investors a deal for coming on board... A couple of men at the table exchange looks with each oth as things get more heated.  36 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Look, you begged me for this IPO. You want me to call Channing Trust?
Ed, what we want to avoid is a down round--
We know what happened with your last IPO.
I don’t think that’s relevant here-- All eyes are on Naomi. Erin speaks up.
Ed, I believe our goal here is to find the right number for all of us. Ed turns to her.
The number is 35. Erin glances briefly at Naomi, as if asking permission. N nods almost imperceptibly.
Possibly. But you can think of it like a party. We need to encourage people to show up to the party. Could be the best party in the world, but if nobody shows up--
A party?
We don’t need to--
No, hang on. I get this. A party. Go on--
The $32 to $34 range will get people in the door. But if the party is good enough--  46
People will line up around the block.
This is true. Ed addresses Erin as if she’s the only person in the room
I like you. He smiles. Ian looks apprehensive.
You know how to talk to people. I‘1l party with you anytime.
Absolutely. She smiles back at him. Naomi watches.
So if we're talking about selling 15% of the company now, we should discuss what options that gives us going forward.

Naomi, in silk pajamas, nibbles room service strawberries she reviews a due diligence checklist. She closes it and flips through open tabs on her computer: a bio of Ed, A l of best dermatologists in NYC, and a Soul Cycle class schedule. She glances up at the TV, playing silently over the bed. Suddenly she fixes her eyes on the screen. She scrambles for the remote control, turning up the volu On the TV:
Footage of a crowd of people and yellow police tape at th foot of a midtown building.  47 38 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

...in Midtown Manhattan, where a young man employed at the hedge fund Treem Capital jumped from his 24th floor office window this afternoon. A source tells Bloomberg News that the firm has been under investigation for insider trading... Naomi watches, disturbed. She goes to the minibar and pul out a small bottle of scotch and a bag of M&Ms. Her eyes still on the screen, she begins popping M&Ms into her mou one by one.

Sam scribbles on a large whiteboard with a cluster of nam and arrows: “Michael,” “Titanite Capital.” The photo of B on his snowboard is tacked up next to his name. Frank pokes his head in, sees Sam crossing out “NAOMI”
How was drinks? She just looks at him.
She’s not going to give me anything.
If we don’t have a good feeling about this one--
We don’t need warm fuzzy fucking feelings. We need evidence. Did your friends in compliance send anything over? He hands her a thick envelope.
Paperwork on Michael. Sam opens the file, her eyes lighting up with interest.
Now don’t go doing anything rash. You’re not in narcotics anymore.  48 39 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Michael joins two hedge fund guys, BENJI, 40’s, the guy f the skiing picture and CORY, 35, a Benji-in-training, at VIP table in a swanky lounge.
Michael, I don’t know if you've ever met Cory? Michael and Cory shake hands.
He’s been with us a long time, but he’s ready to play with the big boys now. Cory tries to laugh this off. A provocatively dressed waitress pours Michael’s Scotch. smiles at her.
What have you got for us?
I’m thinking privacy. He takes a napkin and writes the word Cachet on it in gre pen.
(To Cory) His girlfriend's doing the IPO.
I don't have a girlfriend. Benji smirks, picks up the napkin.
You with these green pens.
Color of money.
What do you know?
Nothing. (His eyes twinkling a bit) It’s private. Benji nods, takes a drink. Turns to Cory.  40 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

I was just outta school when I met this guy. And you know what I saw? He wasn’t doing it for the cash. He loved the game itself. And he played it like a pro. The day I left to start a hedge fund he sends a fucking hedgehog to my office. Michael smiles fondly.
An actual hedgehog?
I open the box and this fuckin rodent is climbing into my lap. Benji leans forward, suddenly serious.
Where is that guy? Michael meets his gaze coolly.
You're different lately. I don’t want to say older, but--
We're all older. Cory nods at this.
I dunno. It’s something-- new regulations getting you down? He stands up, gathering his coat.
I don’t know where you’re going with this--
Because I’m still in. All the way. And we've got capital to invest. So you bring us something, yeah? Benji starts to walk away.

(To Cory) Let’s go.  41 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Cory follows, a bit like a puppy. Michael is left alone, staring after them. 49 INT. CACHET CONFERENCE ROOM. DAY ag Naomi and Erin sort through paperwork.
These are the due diligence reports?

Yes, and they are uploaded to the data room and ready for counsel to review. Naomi catches sight of MARIN, the woman with purple hair, passing by the conference room, glancing at them through glass. Naomi leans over and whispers to Erin.
What’s the story with that girl?
She’s one of the programmers.
That’s the fourth time she’s walked by this morning. Naomi watches through the glass as the Marin moves on.
Michael scrolls through his phone while eating an ice cre cone. Samantha approaches, gives him a mysterious smile.
Michael Connor.
I’m sorry, have we...
I don’t think so. Samantha Ryan. US attorney's office. He was not expecting this.
Really? Should I phone my lawyer?  42 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I don’t think that’s necessary. I was just hoping we could have a brief chat.
Sure. That’s my idea of a perfect summer evening. Just a cozy chat with a long legged woman who just happens to be FBI.
I didn’t say FBI. He waves towards the street.
No, they hang back in the van.
I’m alone. And I’m not interested in you. He leans forward. She nods.
Well that is too bad.
I’m interested in one of your clients, Titanite. Benji Akers.
Well, I’m not sure how I can help you. My relationship with my clients is confidential.

Of course. But these hedge fund guys they’ve always got a loophole, some way of staying out of trouble. But they need a guy like you, right, at a big bank? And you don’t have so many loopholes. You’ve got regulations, compliance looking over your shoulder, handing me intell... So it seems to me, that if anybody’s gonna take the fall, it’s not going to be Benji Acres.
Take the fall for what?  51 43 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

Exactly. Could be anything. Could be a merger last spring when it seemed like certain investors got the memo prematurely, or a bunch of trades that compliance flagged as a irregular... Michael looks at her, thoughtfully. He stands
You don’t have anything on me.
How do you know that?
Because we’d be downtown, with wires and somebody in my face. This is just a cozy chat. Which I have certainly enjoyed. up.
Why don’t you call me back when you've got some leverage.
Is that a challenge?
If you like.
Look, you seem like one of the good guys. All I’m saying is, we can keep it that way. He gives her a nod and walks off into the shadows.
Naomi moves purposefully through a row of cubicles until sees Marin at her desk.
Hi, I’m with the bank handling the
I know. Naomi notices Marin wears a necklace made of shark teeth.
You guys talk to every single employee?
No. You seem particularly interested in our process. In my experience, that usually means you have something you want to tell us.
Wow. You’re good.
So you do have something you want to tell us? Marin hesitates.
Or you just like my shoes. Marin smiles. But then glances around nervously.
Not here.
Naomi and Marin are in the shadows of the parking garage. Marin speaks quickly and glances around nervously. Naomi not sure what to make of her.
Cachet’s got its super secure social network, right. But here’s the thing. What happens if it gets hacked?
It’s anonymized and encrypted at the highest level.
You haven’t met my ex. He’s already done it once. We were beta testing, so it was actually kind of helpful. We plugged the holes. (MORE )
She leans She looks 45 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
But he’ll keep trying. And there might be others.
But why?
The challenge. The naked photos. Who knows. forward and continues quietly.

It’s called a man in the middle attack. Users want to be able to access the network on multiple devices. But that opens up the possibility of somebody implanting malware on the key server. around the park uneasily.
Does Ed know about this?
He thinks I’m paranoid. Which is pretty funny, when a company that’s built on paranoia thinks you're paranoid.
But why tell me?
I want to sell my shares. You can help me with that, right? If this thing goes south? Naomi laughs.
That’s not, what I do.
I got plans. I’m starting a hackerspace. Marin looks around the park again. She notices a woman walking by with a big gold key on a necklace.
You didn’t hear me say that.  53 46 Green Rev. (07/15/15) And she scurries off.
From across the restaurant, Naomi sees Erin and Ed sharin sushi, laughing together. Her blouse shows a little cleav Ed casually puts his hand on Erin’s shoulder. She smiles him.
Tasmanian sea trout? Ed and Erin look up, surprised.
Naomi! Have a seat.
How’s the sushi?
Delicious. Erin pops a piece in her mouth. Naomi indicates Ed’s casu outfit.
I’m liking this look-- you’re going to be the rock star of this roadshow, and people are going to want a piece of that hoodie!
Oh yea.
Ed, I want to make sure we are in good shape here before I leave for New York. Ed glances at Erin.
I am in very good shape.
Terrific. Just one thing I want to ask you about. I’m sure it’s nothing, but something’s come up during due diligence. (MORE)
A rumor that your network, encrypted as it is, might still be vulnerable to a certain kind of hacker. Ed smiles warily.
Sounds like you met Marin.
Yes actually. We were interviewing employees, and--
Unfortunately our business can attract some colorful characters.
You need your employees to be as much a firewall as your code.
Look, I can promise you we’ve never been hacked. In theory there’s a backd door to everything. But we stay one step ahead. That’s the game.
Terrific. She and Erin smile at him. He grins back.
Naomi and Erin walk and talk.
You need me to look into this? I can take care of things here.
Well Ed certainly seems to think so. They stare at each other a moment.
I’m just trying to preserve the relationship.  55 48 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Are you going to sleep with him?
Excuse me?
It's risky territory. When he comes on to you, and he will at this rate, you have to let him down very very gently. That’s how you preserve the relationship.
Yeah. I know how this works.
Okay then. They walk in chilly silence.
(Coolly) Then maybe you can find a way to get him to sign an indemnity clause. If there is any vulnerability for investors here, we can’t be liable.
I’1l handle it. They are approaching the hotel.
And Erin-- keep it quiet. There’s probably nothing here, and the last thing we need is rumors starting.
Sam sits on the steps, delicately balancing a sandwich an giant ream of spreadsheets she is highlighting. Frank approaches with two coffees, and looks over her shoulder.
Titanite accounts from the last five years. He nods, but seems as interested in her sandwich.
The turkey’s better on a roll.  49 Green Rev. (07/15/15) He traces a column on the spreadsheet with his finger.
Deals where somebody might’ve known a little extra.
Always big pharma.

Yep. Clinical trial. Somebody gets too cozy with the researchers. I’ve got my eye on the guy who managed the account. We might get him to talk. Sam’s cell phone rings. She grabs it. SAM (CONT’D) Hello?
Hi, is this Samantha Ryan?
Yes, who’s this?
I’m calling with Marshall Bane and Associates. I have a client who is very interested in recruiting someone with your background and skill set--
(a bit confused) Wait-- I’m sorry, who’s your client?
Right now we’re working with Channing Trust to fill an open position. You may know that they’ve been expanding their legal and compliance departments recently--
Oh. Yeah. Sure, I would like to hear more about that. Frank looks at her suspiciously. SAM (CONT’D) But I’m gonna have to call you back.  50 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Certainly. Sam hangs up the phone.
Which bank?
What?!
You never been called by a headhunter before? Well that’s why they call this place the departure lounge. I’m the only sucker who's been here more than a decade. She smiles at him.
Why do you stay?
Just do me one favor before you talk to those guys. You been on a trading floor, right?
No.
You gotta go there, see what we’re up against. You go, you breathe it in, the hunger of it. Pure American desire. And if you feel like you need a shower afterwards, well then you come back here.
And if I don’t? Need a shower? He looks at her.
You’1l send us a diamond crusted postcard.  51 Green Rev.

head_text.subj: EXT. DECK OF COBALT COCKTAIL LOUNGE. EVENING

text: 56 Sam, now little dressed up, drinks a martini, subtly watc Cory, who sits with another HEDGE FUND GUY, who is talkin excitedly. Cory is nodding a lot, taking gulps of his dri and looking a little jittery. Hedge Fund Guy shakes Cory’s hand and leaves. Cory glance and catches Sam looking at him. She smiles coyly and make her way over to him.
Have we...
Yeah... I think we've... Cory.
Sam. Wait, It was a cocktail thing downtown...
Yea... I think so. Sam sits down, brushing his leg a tiny bit.
And you were telling me about your work. Because you work at... Titans Fund--
Titanite.
Which sounds so intense. You were saying how you have to bring a little something extra. This little bit of... what did you call it... edge?
Yeah. Sam leans forward, whispers.
Edge.
Sam sets down an empty glass.  52 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Amazing. I can’t even balance my checkbook! But wait, last time I feel like you gave me a great example. It was like a clinical trial? I don’t remember the details.
We talked about that? She giggles a little, puts a hand on his knee.

We were a little loose-lipped, if you know what I mean. And it wasn’t even the good stuff! She takes a sip of his drink. SAM (CONT’D) But yeah, you had done all this research and even talked to one of the scientists. It was for MS, right? That’s why I was so interested, because my mom has it. She watches him, to see if she’s taking this too far, but nods.
Oh. Yeah, I remember that. Sorry--
But the drug was a mess, right? The scientist, wait, he’s a big deal... I’ve read about him. What was his name? Dr. Soden?
Dr. Sobel. Sam smiles. This is the confirmation she was looking for.

Right, so he told you. And that’s how you get edge. He’s looking at her a little nervously now. She sees Benj enter the lounge. SAM (CONT’D) Will you call me sometime?  57 58 53 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She scribbles her full name and number on a napkin. She d into the bathroom.

Naomi runs through the park in sleek workout clothes. She breathes hard, pushing herself. She glances behind her a couple of times. Why does she fe like someone is watching her? Someone runs up from behind, making her jump. It’s Michael, grinning.
(laughing) Jesus! You’re stalking me.
Some people nap after the redeye. Others run.
I can’t sleep.
Want to talk about it?
No. She starts up a slow run again. He joins her.
I met an old friend of yours. Samantha. She looks at him.
Why?
I thought you could tell me. I’m not the one who’s besties with the US attorney. They run on together into the distance.  59

60 54 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. DAWN 59 The buzz of Sam’s phone wakes her. She glances at it brie turns to admire a sleeping Melanie, gently pulling down t sheet and beginning to kiss her chest. Melanie murmurs encouragement, eyes still closed. Sam’s phone buzzes again, more insistently. This time she grabs it.
Hello?
Fuck you.
This must be Cory. INT. CORY’S BEDROOM. DAY. INTERCUT SCENES 59A Cory paces in front of his window. He’s been up all night
I googled you.
Of course you did.
You’re a fucking prosecutor?!
I'd like to hear more about your contact with Dr. Sobel--
You can talk to my lawyer.
I look forward to it. She hangs up, eyes on Melanie, who has gone back to sleep
A golf cart delivers Naomi to where JOHN, her mentor, mid 50s, exuding a relaxed confidence, stands overlooking an entire golf course. He greets her with open arms.
Naomi!  61 55 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She kisses him on the cheek.
You want to play? Cause I didn’t waste a dozen Sundays teaching you strokes for you to ride around in a cart.
You’re not playing.
I play. I own the fucking place. It’s boring as shit. The playing, the owning, give me a fucking break. She smiles. She truly loves this guy. He’s the father she never had.
John and Naomi walk over the green.
That's a tricky one. A disgruntled employee is not the most reliable source.
I know. And she’s backpedaling. Now she won’t give me anything concrete.
And on paper--
Everything looks perfect. Our IT guys at Remson and they think this network is as airtight as they’ve seen.
So what’s the problem? She looks at him. Not sure if she wants to open up. But t is why she’s come.
There’s just this nagging feeling...  62 56 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
In your gut.
You taught me to trust my gut. But I don’t want to make the wrong move here. He nods, thoughtful.
That sounds like fear. Which is not the same as instinct. You know why this is a business for the young? It’s not the physical stamina. It’s the complete lack of doubt.
So I should keep it going.

I’m not going to tell you what to do, Naomi. But if the numbers check out, then it sounds like we're talking about a rumor here. And rumors... they’re the wildcard. You can’t control ‘em. And once you let em inside your head, well then who the fuck knows.
Must be nice. To not have to give a shit any more.
I never really gave a shit.
Sam confronts Cory and ATTORNEY CAHN. Cory looks hungover
We both know your client crossed the line.
Look at him! He’s a dad! The man works 80 hours a week. He raises money for leukemia--
Does he plant daffodils too?  63 57 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
He has no history, he’s never been flagged by you guys, or the SEC.

Are you saying he doesn’t know any better? I have a six-year-old kid, she knows better. When you, and your boss, and your friends, decide to sabotage a company. When you get information that regular Joe Investor couldn’t possibly access, and you profit from that information while Joe Investor loses 65% of his retirement fund? You know better.
Are you charging my client or not?
That depends.
He’s not the one you want. There are bigger fish at Titanite.
And he’s prepared to cooperate? Cory’s tired face, bloodshot eyes.
John touches Naomi’s arm as they walk.
Hey-- you've got this. She looks at him, grateful.
Can I ask you something. What would you have done? If I got pregnant when I was working for you?
Bought you the latest stroller.
No really. You wouldn’t have been disappointed? Off the record. Would you have kept pushing for me?  64 58 Green Rev. (07/15/15) He eyes her warily.
Of course.
Of course. What else are you going to say? Well I’m not afraid to say it. It makes a girl weak. Distracted. John softens.
Naomi--
It gives her perspective. That other things matter. She looks at him, forces a smile.
Randall stares out the window at the city. He turns sharp as Naomi steps through the door.
What the fuck happened this time?
What do you mean?
I got a call from Ed. It appears you’ve managed to rub him the wrong way.
We were doing our due diligence.
Cachet has provided you with all the necessary documents? And nobody's flagged anything.
No, but--
What’s the fucking problem? Ed’s losing patience fast-- he thinks you lack confidence in this IPO. (MORE )
So I ask you again, what’s the fucking problem? Naomi takes a deep breath.
There is no problem. I have absolute confidence in this IPO.
Terrific.
Excuse me. I’ve got a roadshow to launch. She strides out of the office.
Erin, on the phone and trying to balance a green juice an file of papers, navigates the garage, looking for the sta
You pissed off Ed.
Wait-- I pissed him off? INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. DAY 65A Naomi flips through messages. INTERCUT SCENES
What happened? I told you, you have to handle a guy like this very gently.
What happened was I got him to sign the indemnity clause.
What? He did?
Yeah. Because I handled him very, very gently.
(Chilly) Well then. Good work.  66 67 60 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Thank you. Naomi hangs up. Her assistant pokes her head in.
Did you want me to reschedule that dermatologist for after the trip? Naomi stares at her like she has no idea what she’s talki about.
I'll do that.
Sam gets a text from Cory: GREENSLEEVES PUB, 43rd.
Michael drains a scotch. Benji walks in and tosses him a tied with a bow.
Happy birthday. Michael tears it open. Inside is a large stuffed animal hedgehog. Michael laughs.
Very cute.
I don’t know, he may have gone a bit soft. He grins, amused at his own joke.
Where are we on this Cachet thing? I saw the IPO calendar. Think it’s solid?
I’m working on it. Benji nods. Takes a long look at Michael.
You doing any of that botox? For the eyelids? Because I got a guy.  68 69 70 71 61 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I’1l bear that in mind. Benji nods.
You know my cousin Evan?
He’s at PJ Ellis?
Not anymore. Worked there 30 years. Regulations come along, he can’t get his numbers, they push him out.
That’s awful.
Now he’s knocking on my door, am I looking to hire somebody? Fucking tragedy. Michael reaches for the last of his scotch.

Sam peers in the window of the pub and snaps a quick phot Benji and Michael. INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 69 Michael rubs his eyes at the computer. A box appears on t screen: “This is a secure data room. PASSWORD:---------- ” Michael stares at the screen. He tries a few variations of “Bankerchick” with no succes

head_text.subj: A PLANE TAKING OFF AT DAWN, (STOCK FOOTAGE)

text: Naomi and her team enter a room filled with men in suits.  72 73 74 75 76 62 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Title card: LOS ANGELES.
The same Conference Room with new production design and n extras. The Cachet logo of the gold key made up of code. Ed and Ian, flanked by Naomi and Erin, address a crowd of in suits munching cookies.
Cachet is not a social network with privacy settings...
Title card: LONDON.
The same Conference Room with new production design and n extras.
We are a privacy company with a social network. More men in suits. Tea and biscuits. Erin displays a graph of revenue, Ian looking on. Ed pose for a selfie. Bill leans over to Teddy.
Dude, my dad keeps texting me. He wants a piece of Cachet.
Naomi and Erin climb a flight of stairs. Suddenly Erin sw a bit, dizzy. Naomi grips her arm, steadies her.
I’1l handle this one.  77 78 79 80 63 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I’ve got it. Erin pushes on.
Title Card: PHILADELPHIA
77 78 The same Conference Room with new production design and n extras. Investors elbow each other out of the way to reach a plat cookies shaped like keys. An INVESTOR approaches Ed and Naomi.
I know the experts are impressed by your encryption, but let’s say I’m a hacker and I break into your server. The crowd gets quiet, interested. Naomi glances at Ed.
Well that’s the purpose of end-to- end encryption. Naomi nods.
Unencrypted content is never on the server. And don’t forget about ephemeral storage. Their confidence invigorates the crowd.

head_text.subj: A TRAIN PULLING INTO PENN STATION, (STOCK FOOTAGE)

text: 79 80 Naomi watches the buildings of Manhattan sliding by, as s listens to a message.  64 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

Forget thread count. I got new sheets woven from organic French flax plants. Naomi smiles, shakes her head. As she deletes the message reminder pops up on her phone: Dr. Romler, 4:30 p.m., tomorrow. Her expression sobers, as she returns to lookin out the window. 81 INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 81 Erin drags her suitcase behind her as she enters. Gabe gr papers, nursing a beer.
Hey babe! She kisses him. He squeezes her tightly.
I gotta go to bed. She heads for the bedroom. Gabe follows.
You must be exhausted... 82 INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 82 Erin perches on the bed, already immersed in her blackber Gabe pops his head in.
Don’t forget, doctor tomorrow.
Oh fuck.
Wow. I was actually feeling pretty excited about it. Twelve weeks.
It’s just-- there’s a lot going on. She starts pulling on her pajamas.
Yeah. There is. We need to talk.  65 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
You want to talk now?
Look at this place-- where does the nursery go? Erin grabs her toothbrush. She scans the apartment.
I’m not commuting from Jersey.
Your promotion’1l cover a bigger place here.
Are you seriously putting that pressure on me right now?
What? You’re the one who said-- She climbs into bed.
Not tonight. He looks at her a moment.
I want to go back to school.
What                        !! She stares at him, incredulous.
I’ve told you about these programs, to take your teaching to the next level--
I can’t deal with this right now--

Of course you can’t. I’1ll send you a fucking email. He heads back into the living room.  83 84 66 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. NIGHT 83 Naomi sleeps, curled on her side like a baby. Michael lie next to her, eyes open, watching her. He reaches out and gently brushes a hair out of her face. Naomi’s phone suddenly vibrates on the nightstand. Michae eyes go to the phone, its tiny flashing green light. He l at Naomi again, then the phone. He sits up, hesitates, an gingerly reaches over her to take the phone. Of course a passcode is needed. He looks at the number pa moment. Tries a number which doesn’t work. Naomi stirs in the bed. Michael freezes. She murmurs something inaudible. He leans over and replaces the phone lies back down, eyes still open.
Sam and Melanie load the dishwasher, but Sam’s eyes are o her phone.
That mug’s not dishwasher safe--
Then why do we own it?
Look, just let me do it--
I’m prepping for this--
Interview. Sam meets her gaze.
I can prep you. It’s a bunch of old white guys who have ALL the money...
They need good lawyers in Compliance to watch things from the inside, keep things legit.  67 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Uh-huh.
Hey, do you want a sugar-mama or not? I’m trying to help support my wife so she can pursue her artistic... impulses.
Impulses? Babe, don’t pretend you’re doing this for me.
Doing what? Selling out?
Those are your words.
You do realize my salary MAXES OUT next year. Which is why nobody stays at the prosecutor's office--
What about Frank?
Frank lives in a studio in Hoboken! He does not have kids. He does not have a wife who has to see some out- of-network foot doctor for her tendinitis.
Wow-- I didn’t realize we were such a burden.
I’m just trying to live in the real world here! Suddenly she sees that Sophie has quietly entered the roo her pajamas. It’s unclear how much she has heard. SAM (CONT’D) Sweetheart?
I need some water. Sam goes to the sink and fills a glass with tap water.  85 68 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Naomi sits on an exam table. Under the fluorescent lights a skimpy gown, she looks unusually vulnerable. A female doctor, pretty, and no-nonsense, examines her.
I don’t see any other area of concern. Just this area here. She reaches out and touches the spot just where Naomi’s j meets her ear.
It’s a typical squamous cell presentation.
(Matter of fact) You’re saying I have skin cancer.
Well, this tissue may turn out to be malignant, yes. In most cases, it’s resolved when we remove the tissue.
You can do that today?
We're going to have to schedule something...
I want it gone. The doctor nods.
I may be able to squeeze you in next week.
Jesus. I’m going to be all over the news next week. I can’t have a fucking wound on my neck. What happens if I wait?
I would advise--
Is this thing is going to kill me?  86 69 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I’m not going to answer that. We need to remove the tissue, and--
I can do it September 5. Afternoon. The doctor regards her a little coolly.

You'll have to arrange that with my secretary. I’1ll let you get dressed. The doctor exits. Naomi slowly begins to get dressed. She looks around the room: a box of rubber gloves, a medical waste bin, a poster that shows grimacing cartoon faces expressing levels of pain.

The same chart of cartoon faces ranking pain. Erin lies on the table in the skimpy gown, as the technic moves the ultrasound wand over her belly. She and Gabe wa the movement on the screen. Gabe grabs her hand.
Can you believe it?
No... She is a little awestruck. Her phone rings. Erin immediately reaches across Gabe to it out of her bag.
This is Erin. Hello? Hello? The technician and Gabe share a glance.
I can’t get a signal.
Hon--
It’s that woman I told you about. She coaches people on the whole working mom thing--  87 88 89 70 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
She might tell you to enjoy your ultrasound. She takes this in. Looks back at the ultrasound screen.

Sam, escorted by a SECURITY GUARD, walks onto a trading floor, taking it all in. A cavernous space filled with ro row of desks dwarfed by giant screens flashing ever-chang numbers. A conspicuous number of desks are empty. Financi news plays on additional screens on the walls. Sam watches, fascinated. A sleek young BROKER approaches.
You looking for something sweetheart?
Sweetheart? Seriously? Is this
You look a little lost.
I thought it would be louder.
Those were the old days.

Now you just rule the world by IM? He nods, cocky. She steps a little closer. On one screen notices the names of different cities, flashing along wit the numbers as the traders type in the eerie silence. She breathes it in, a slight smile on her face.

90 71 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. EVENING 90 Naomi works steadily, but she is beginning to fight exhaustion. She touches the spot on her jaw lightly. She flips through a bundle of messages; she likes what sh sees. She picks up her phone.
Teddy, I’m just seeing these last- minute bids for shares. What else have we got?
Xandos and Redding are upping their orders. Naomi smiles.
This thing is getting hot. Keep ‘em coming. She hangs up. She rubs her eyes, turns back to her comput Her assistant enters, sets down an espresso.
You need anything else?
No. She remains focused on her screen. The assistant hovers.
Everything go okay, with your appointment?
Of course. She resumes typing. The assistant hesitates just a moment more, then goes. Naomi glances at the window. She gathers up her briefcase coat. Turns to her assistant on her way out.
I’m going to finish up at home.  91 72 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Erin attempts to keep up with JULIE, a woman in an impecc suit, who is hurrying through the park, pushing a strolle
I want to be strategic. Erin tries to catch a glimpse of the sleeping baby.
First things first. Can you get named Managing Director before the baby comes? Second trimester is ideal.
I don’t know anymore. Naomi is looking out for her own promotion, and--
Look, Naomi’s been your mentor, that’s nice. But let’s be real here. Julie approaches a bench where a Hispanic NANNY is waitin
Excuse me. Julie speaks Spanish to the nanny, who nods and takes the stroller. Julie turns her attention immediately back to E
How much do you want this? Erin stares at her. She has never had to articulate this before.
Because this is the moment. When people step off, they see some tiny blue booties, and they hesitate, and that’s it. You can’t hesitate. So how much do you want it?
I want it. I’ve always wanted it. My dad was a trader and when I was a kid I would put on his ties and beg him to take me to work, and --
That’s cute. But--
It’s all I ever wanted. Julie nods, convinced.
Then you need to forget about Naomi. You need someone who can reach over and bring you up. Now. Erin nods, she knows this is true.
Who else are you networking with? You know anyone on the executive committee? Erin’s phone buzzes. She glances at it, doesn’t like what sees.

Do what you need to do. EXT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT. NIGHT A92 INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 92 Naomi picks at a salad as she works on her laptop on the couch. She fingers the spot on her jaw again. She turns to the computer and googles “squamous cell.” Cl up photos of skin abnormalities appears. Her phone buzzes. She looks at it: Erin. She does not ans Looks back at the photos on the computer.
Erin approaches where Ed waits for her at the bar.
Hi, you got in okay? We need to talk about that email.
Whoa, you ever relax? Have a drink.  94 95 74 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
I'd love to, but there’s a million things to do for tomorrow, and-- He puts a finger to her lips.
This place has an amazing view.
Ed... Ed puts his arm around Erin’s waist. She does not resist.
We’ve gotta keep our eye on the ball here. Ed pulls Erin in for a kiss. She pulls away gently.
Listen, these personnel changes you referred to--
Come on Erin. You’re what, a VP? If I really want to talk business, I‘1l call Naomi. She looks at him, stung. She turns to go.

Erin... She walks quickly through the lobby, the sounds and light blurring around her. Her foot catches on a luggage cart a she nearly crashes into two women with fur coats and shop bags. She pushes through, just trying to get to the stree
Erin emerges into the night air, steadying herself, breat hard. She pulls out her phone, scans her email, dials.

Naomi, call me when you get this. We may have a problem. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 95 Images of skin cancer still fill the laptop screen on Nao lap. But she has fallen asleep on the couch.  96 97

75 Green Rev. (07/15/15) EXT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT BUILDING. NIGHT 96 Erin buzzes Naomi’s apartment. No answer. She turns to go INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 97 Michael reviews data on his computer, drinking a glass of wine. His buzzer sounds. He crosses to it.
It's Erin Manning. Surprised, he buzzes her up. EXT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 97A Erin walks into the building.
Michael opens the door.
Hi, I’m sorry to bother you, but I’m wondering if Naomi’s here?
Um no, she is not.
Something came up and I couldn’t get hold of her. I thought maybe--
She’s not at her place?
No. Sorry for showing up here like this.
You're here, might as well have a glass of wine. Come on in.
Really? I’m not interrupting you--
Nah.  76 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She enters the apartment. He pours her a glass of wine. S surveys the space, noticing a framed photo of two teenage kids.
Your kids? He nods.
(Affectionately) Spoiled little shits. Mostly they visit me to piss off my ex. He hands her the glass.
I won’t stay long.
Don’t worry, I’m not going to ask you about where else she spends the night. We’re all grown ups here. Erin smiles awkwardly at this, takes a sip of wine.
This is nice. Her phone buzzes. She looks at it, shakes her head. Grabs pen from Michael's desk and jots something down.
You said something came up tonight? To do with Cachet? She looks at him.
Yeah. It’s just... I can’t really go into it.
Of course. I mean if you want to talk it through, we can keep it hypothetical--
Naomi did mention you’d hit a snag, with due diligence. She looks up sharply.  77 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Naomi said that?
She doesn’t go into detail, but I think we both find it helpful to talk things through, to get another perspective.
You’re telling me Naomi brings you across the wall?
No, not officially.
You know, she warned me about you. She told me once, you always have an agenda.
(Quietly) Well. She would know. He reaches over and pours more wine.
What’s my agenda now?
You seem to think I’m going to give you information about my IPO.
Maybe I’m just enjoying the company. Erin takes a sip of wine.

Everyone’s got an agenda. You’ve been waiting on a promotion. You know that. I know that. And we know how these things happen. You do your work, kiss up to Naomi, and keep hoping this deal will be the one. Or you try other avenues. Erin just looks at him.
I’ve been at Remson a long time. A lot of people there respect my opinion.
78 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Erin hesitates. Her phone buzzes. She looks at it. It’s Naomi. It buzzes again. Erin picks up.
Hi. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT -KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT. INTER SCENES. Naomi pours herself some water.
I saw your messages.
Naomi-- I need to call you back.
Why? You met with Ed, and what--
Let me just - hang on a second-- She is looking at Michael.
Where are you right now? Erin?
I am... at my place. Slowly she sits back down, holding the phone. Michael wat her. She hits speakerphone.
Yea, so, Ed tells me they did let go a few people last week.
That was the recommendation.
I know, but-- one of them was Marin.
Are you kidding me? She’s a liability! If she starts making claims about holes in the network--  98
79 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Erin looks at Michael. He listens quietly.
I know. Listen, I’ve got her number here. Michael’s fingers are hovering over his phone.
Got it. Erin hangs up the phone. Michael looks at her.
Well, Erin, it’s been a pleasure. She stands, goes to the door, turns back.
What are you going to do?
With what? She holds his gaze a moment and then goes into the hall, pulling the door closed behind her.

head_text.subj: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE. NIGHT, (SAME HOTEL AS P. 71)

text: Ed drinks a beer, reaching for his ringing phone.
Hi Naomi.
You fired Marin. Now?
Look, it wasn’t my call. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 98A Naomi paces. INTERCUT SCENES.
Everything is your call.  99 100 80 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
We've got it under control. She got a very nice severance, and our legal team had her sign all kinds of shit.
I’m concerned about this. I wish you had consulted me -
Hey Naomi, news flash-- I don’t work for you. And I gotta tell you, the doubts, the second-guessing-- I’m getting tired of it. I mean we got orders pouring in, right?
It’s my job to be thorough.

Yeah? ‘Cause I thought it was your job to be inspiring. Ed hangs up. Naomi pulls out her Blackberry and looks at Marin’s phone number. She hesitates. She dials the number rings and rings. No answer. Naomi opens the fridge and takes out a bottle of wine, an the fish food. Naomi puts her face close to the glass of the fish tank. watches the glittery creature swim through the large tank completely unaware of her.
INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 100 Erin finds Gabe sleeping on the couch, in the flickering light of the TV. She makes a noise and he startles awake.
Hon, what’s wrong?
(Flatly) Nothing. She stares at his sleeping form.

101 102 103 104 81 Green Rev. (07/15/15) INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN. NIGHT Al01 Naomi kickboxes a little wildly, her trainer egging her o She wipes sweat from her brow. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. MORNING 101 Sam sits in a lotus position, attempting to meditate. She tries to ignore the sound of her phone vibrating, but her eyes keep popping open. Finally she gives up and she reac for her phone. A message from Cory: MADE CONTACT.
Naomi’s team, Cachet management, and lawyers crowd the ro

I want to thank you all for your patience, as we’ve been processing this terrific surge in orders from institutional investors. The order book is now closed, and we've got our offering price, $35. Nods of approval around the table. Ed fist bumps Ian.
Cachet just raised $250 million. Ed grins, stands up as the room applauds. As people filte out of the room, Naomi notices the green pen that Erin is using to jot down notes.
Where did you get that pen?
(Genuine) I don’t know. She tosses it in her bag and leaves the room with the oth
Color of money.  105 106 107 82 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Naomi stares after Erin.
Michael is outside the pub, looking in. He sees Benji wai for him. He takes a breath and heads inside.
Michael takes a seat next to Benji and Cory at the bar. T drink.
Cory and I have a bet on how much you spent on my birthday present.
To many more. Michael slides a large wrapped box across the bar. Benji it open. Inside is the stuffed hedgehog, with a bow aroun its neck.
Nice. Benji sets the hedgehog on the bar.
Sam grills Cory, who sits with his Attorney.
What, like a porcupine??
Hedgehog. But cute, fuzzy. Get it? Hedge fund? Money hog?
I get it. And Benji took it with him?
Yup. He reaches under his collar and pulls out a microphone, h it to her.
Is that it?  108 109 110 83 Green Rev. (07/15/15)

Are you fucking kidding me? You belong to us. INT. GREENSLEEVES PUB MEN’S ROOM. EVENING 108 Benji fingers a pocket knife. He waits for a man to finis using the urinal and exit. He cuts into the stuffed anima belly, and pulls out a tiny slip of paper pushed into the stuffing. Tiny handwriting -- a phone number and the name: Marin. INT. NAOMI’S OFFICE. NIGHT 109 Naomi begins to shut down her computer when she spots the Google alert. She clicks on it. A blog post. The headline is: “Cachet IPO Not a Secure Thing.” Naomi sees the words: “Former Cachet employee.” Naomi dials Marin. There is some fumbling as Marin actual picks up, her voice quivering a little.
Hello?
Marin, it’s Naomi Bishop.
Marin speaks quietly from the driver’s seat of her messy INTERCUT SCENES.
Do you understand what’s happening here? Cachet can sue you.
They said they would take care of all that.
Who did? Who said that? Are they paying you?
I’m sorry.  111 84 Green Rev. (07/15/15) And she hangs up. Naomi turns back to her screen, staring the photo of the blogger: Marco Evans. Naomi dials her phone again.
Get me a car to Brooklyn. South Slope. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 111 Melanie holds open the door a crack, the chain on. She se Naomi.
I'm a friend of Sam's. Melanie looks her over, recognizes her.
Nice shoes.
Thank you. Melanie opens the door. William and Sophie perch on tall kitchen stools, devouring boxed mac & cheese.
Let me grab her. She goes.
Hi there. You must be William?
I don’t talk to strangers.
That's fine, but it’s really your friends that will stab you in the back. William considers this. Sam enters the room.
Naomi. What are you doing here?
I want you to tell me what you know. About Michael.  112 85 Green Rev. (07/15/15) Sam glances at Sophie and Mel.
Why don’t we go into my office. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT —- BEDROOM. NIGHT 112 The small bedroom doubles as the “office”, A standing des in the corner.
You’ve been investigating him.
I can’t really comment on that.
Somebody leaked rumors about my IPO. I’m doing this IPO, and somebody--
I know.
The tech blogger, who broke the story? That’s an old friend of Michael’s. From Stanford. It had to be him, right?

Do you think it was? Naomi hears this. Realizes she may be about to give somet away instead of getting something. SAM (CONT’D) Look, as far as this IPO goes, we don’t have any specific link to Michael at this time. Except you. You're the link.
Wait-- are you saying I gave him information?
I’m not saying anything. Naomi is on guard now. Realizing this is a bad idea.
I should go.  113 86 Green Rev. (07/15/15) She gets up.
You don’t have to go. I can help you. Did he--

He did not get this from me. Do you understand that? That is not who I am. She turns and heads rapidly back through the apartment, h heels clicking on the floor as she exits. INT. MICHAEL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT 113 An unshaven, tired-looking Michael lets Naomi into the lo They look at each other a moment.
Hi.
Are you tanking my IPO? Michael pours wine into two glasses.
Should I be?
I swear Michael. Do not fuck with me on this. Did you leak this thing?
Is it true?
It doesn’t matter if it’s true! You know that. Once the rumors start -
Start your own rumors. You know how to play this. She stares at him.
What is wrong with you?! I had this. This was mine and you fucked me. (MORE)
Did you take my phone one night when I was sleeping? Or was it Erin? Did she tell you something? He smiles faintly.
Are you wearing a wire?
What do you think?
Lets take our clothes off. Find out. For a moment, we think she’s going to do this.
Wow. It really is all just a big game to you, isn’t it -- all of it?
What else is there? He seems to be really asking. She takes this in. She crosses to the door.
Listen, whatever happens tomorrow. You'll be fine. Something bursts in her.
Fine? I do not want to be fine. I did not work my ass off for 20 years for FINE!! I’m not supposed to be fine! I am supposed to be a rainmaker.
INT. NAOMI’‘S APARTMENT - KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. 3AM 115 Naomi paces around like a caged tiger, on Various phone calls.  116 117 118 88 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
No, that’s for PR to handle. They got a long reach. Hang on--
We can discredit her. There’s a history of psychological problems. Yes, depression, mania...
I’m looking at the report from our Hong Kong security guys. I mean if those guys can’t figure out the hack--

Please tell Ed that will not be necessary. I mean I appreciate his creativity, but-- look, just wake the fuck up and call me. She hangs up, rubs her eyes, and brews more espresso. INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. 5 A.M. 116 Erin struggles to zip her skirt over the beginnings of a “bump.” She check out the profile of her body in the mirr tugs at the skirt. Gabe sleeps peacefully in the bed. INT. NAOMI’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. MORNING. 5 A.M. 117 Naomi applies concealer on her neck, covering the patch o skin that the doctor had examined. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT. MORNING 5. A.M. 118 Sam can’t sleep. She reaches over a sleeping Melanie and grabs her computer. Goes to Bloomberg, sees: “CACHET GOES PUBLIC TODAY.” She clicks on a video. A Bloomberg reporter is interviewi Ed and Ian.
So this is the big day for you and your shareholders.
Absolutely. There is a brief awkward moment where she waits for him t say more, then plunges forward.
Now just in the last 12 hours, reports have surfaced that hackers may be attempting to access this secure network? Ian looks like he is prepared to answer, but Ed goes firs

I want to take this moment to personally reassure our investors. This morning, I have uploaded three photos to my own profile on the Cachet network. And I don’t mind telling you, that these photos, they are highly personal in nature. If you know what I mean. Ian jumps in.
What Ed means is-- there has been never been a security breach on this network, and --
If anybody thinks they can access my photos, I say go ahead and try. Ian is still trying to get a word in.
Well, that certainly should be compelling to the investors out there.
Erin approaches the building and sees Naomi waiting for h
What’s going to happen in there?  120
Well, hopefully--
Don’t give me that. Did you leak this?
I don’t know what you mean.
I know you were with Michael that night.
I was not with Michael.
If you sabotaged this thing... do you have any idea how stupid that is? What the fuck did you do?
I didn’t do anything!
You needed this.
(quietly) You don’t know what I need. You never fucking did. Erin marches inside. INT. SAM’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM. MORNING Sam answers her phone as she quickly dresses.
Hello, Samantha.
You need to look into Erin Manning, my VP on this deal.
Naomi?
She had contact with Michael. 120
I’1l do that.

Naomi and her team are at a bank of computers. She gazes at a large television showing live coverage of the stock exchange, in an echo of the first scene of the script: A mass of people humming with anticipation, traders shoutin photos flashing. Naomi turns her attention to the computer screen in front her, watching the quickly changing numbers of the share allocation.
We’ve got FBA for 30,000 shares. Xandos for 50,000. She leans into a speakerphone.
What have we got for foreign?
Tioros requested 75,000. We’ve got China for 70. The graphs on the screen flicker and change.
Naomi oversees her team allocating the shares, her eyes darting from screen to screen.
Rexel Brothers requested 50,000 shares.
I’ve got Cabreau Fund for 60.
Milton Group wants 50.
We’ll have Boon Portfolio ina minute...
Are we close?  123
We're almost there.
We've got Redding for 75.
No, wait, Boon is out.
What?
Boon’s hitting the exits.
Milton Ellis is pulling out too.
Fuck! She leans in to the speakerphone.
Arthur, Jonathan, we have to anchor this thing.
It’s 5 minutes to market open, and the underwriters of the highly anticipated Cachet IPO are nearly finished allocating shares to institutional investors...
The buzz of anticipation on the floor. Ed, looking especially sharp, steps up and proudly rings opening bell.
And the market is open! Privacy company Cachet goes public today, and we will be watching to see how that stock trends, and what time it’s going to trade--  124 93 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
Chaos. Restless energy on the floor.
I’ve got a bid for 100 at 32.
