200 at 30. The screens change by the second, as Naomi and the team t orders coming in.
What have we got?
We're getting it. Naomi glances up at the TV coverage of the NYSE, where th crowd is growing impatient.
This thing’s gotta start trading-- An NYSE OFFICIAL cuts in on speakerphone.
Is there a problem over there?
We're finishing the share allocation. Traders buzz with impatience. Naomi sees Randall approach
We need this price.
Jesus. People are pissing themselves. When are we opening?
Any minute now.
What’s the hold up?? What’s our fucking price? Naomi leans over Erin’s shoulder, trying to stay calm.
We're in the $29 to $31 range.  125 126
Randall storms away.
Michael watches his screens, on the phone with Benji.
Benji, on his phone, watches his Lyft car pull up.
Hang on. My Lyft is here. He climbs into the car.
Talk to me. Where are we?
More chaos. On TV, we see/hear an ENERGETIC REPORTER:

Now we've had our eye on this Cachet IPO all season. But trouble seems to be on the horizon, with whispers thatthis social network they’re promoting might be just as hackable as my neighbor's Wi-Fi. Erin and Bill are bent over the computer. Naomi hovers.
Where are we?
(quietly) Twenty eight.  128 129 130 131 95 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
What                        ! Are you fucking kidding me. Get the desk. They better be buying. Erin nods and grabs the phone. We see/hear:

Price discovery has just been completed on the IPO for the privacy company Cachet. The opening price of $28 has dropped significantly from the offering price of $35. We will be tracking the offering throughout the day. Naomi looks like a warrior in battle.
A portal with the Remson logo shows the share price dropp 28, 26, 24.
I’ve got no ask!
Where’s the fucking bottom on this one? Naomi addresses her team.
Come on guys. We can still stabilize this thing! Erin, on the phone, her face a mask of tension.
Benji, on his phone and laptop, watches the stock fall.
Wait for it. I want in at 22.
Sam watches Bloomberg.
2 P.M. On the floor: The American flag. DMM’s, sporting Cachet tee-shirts, swiftly type and log numbers.
Erin vomits in the bathroom toilet.
Naomi watches the screens like a hawk. The price is $22. A trader on the floor suddenly jumps up.
Hang on we got bids coming in. Titanite is buying.
Benji’s eyes are on his phone. He nods, smiles, and strid from the lounge toward a waiting helicopter. He boards the helicopter.
The helicopter ascends.

head_text.subj: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE. DAY, (SAME HOTEL AS SC 93)

text: A somber Ed nurses a beer, watching the coverage from NYS TV. Ian takes the seat next to him, but Ed barely acknowledges him.
3:57 PM. Closing time. Naomi’s fingers fly over the keyboard. Erin reaches over the next desk, holding out a sandwich.
Get that out of my face.
You haven’t eaten anything. Naomi glances over at Teddy and Bill. They are typing quickly, while devouring giant chocolate chip cookies.
Get me one of those. She turns back to her computer, noticing something.
What the hell. She picks up her phone.
I want to know who the fuck thinks they’re going to make money off this train wreck! She hangs up. Bill is holding a large cookie out to her. takes it, looks at it.
What the fuck is this??
You said-- She shoves it back towards Bill.
How many chocolate chips are in my cookie?
Um...
Did anyone teach you basic math? Count the fucking chips.
Three.
I saw your cookies! They were oozing with chocolate. But my cookie has three goddamn chips                        ! Erin, Bill and a few others are staring at Naomi.
Someone get the woman a decent cookie.
The closing bell rings.

Naomi stares up at the TV with the closing price: 23.74. The chaos around them begins to die down. Naomi turns and walks off the floor. INT. ERIN’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 141 Erin lies on the couch, Bloomberg on in the background. G enters, watches.
Cachet lost nearly 20% of its market cap on this first day of trading... Erin shuts it off.
It didn’t go well?  142 143 144 99 Green Rev. (07/15/15)
You have no idea? I mean it didn’t occur to you, to turn on the TV today? He looks at her.

I don’t know. Does it ever occur to you, in the middle of your day, to check on how my middle-schoolers are doing? Erin gets up in icy silence and disappears into the bedro Gabe considers following her, but settles down on the cou instead. INT. NAOMI’S KITCHEN/LIVING ROOM. NIGHT 142 Naomi finishes the last of a bottle of wine, watching mut Bloomberg coverage on the exchange floor, focusing on the reporter’s mouth moving silently. Naomi stands, feeling the wine a little, and takes her wi glass to the kitchen. She stops abruptly, noticing that her fish is floating on top of the tank.
